', 'Product operates exactly as advertised, which nowadays is not always the case. It functions easily and simply. I live in Wisconsin, on a 18 degree November morning this heater warmed our non-insulated 2-1/2 car garage to 72 degrees in a little over 2 hours (on the highest setting).  Does not come with electronic ignition but that's not a deal breaker.  Starts easily (just don't stand above it when lighting)    Seems well made.  Quality product with very good packaging.  I do not regret this purchase!", 'I use to have a smaller, 15000 size tank top and the winters in the cinder block garage were tough. This product is faster and I feel more efficient to operate, thumbs up here', 'I use this out in my 20x12 shed, keeps me warm when I am working or just sitting out there. It get pretty cold where I live and it is nice to go out and fire it up. Within a couple minutes, it’s toasty, ready to work. ', "I think that it's ok for use inside a shop but not for what I wanted to use it for which is outside use. now that's not the fault of the seller, it was on me and this by no means is a bad review.  I take full responsibility for this purchase. thanks ", 'Easy assembly and has plenty of heating power, its also a low profile so is space saving, also simple to light with a wood match or long lighter', 'Great emergency heater!  It took no time to heat up a couple rooms of a little trailer, and the heater was only on low!  At that setting a tank of propane should last around 14hrs.  I imagine on high it would be the type of heater that several people could stand around in some pretty cold weather and keep warm, like during ice skating.  Even on high, a tank should last about 9.5hrs.  A good value!', "I love this little gadget. We've had the tall metal heaters for years and they've gotten so rusty and nasty and they take up so much room on our deck. This one is small, easy to hook up, easy to use, and it really heats the place up.", 'I really like it. Type this into YouTube and see my video reviewType... Mr. Heater F242540 45,000 BTU 540 Degree Propane Heater.I made the review I was looking for and could not find. My gas meter and regulator went bad in Pennsylvania on one of the coldest days of the year. I was caught unprepared. Now at least I have a backup portable heat source. I wish I could add my video to this post but it will only let me add pictures. So go check out my video.', 'It works awesome but eats up propane fast. On low a 20 lb tank only lasts about 6 hrs. But i still love it', 'I got it because i use in in my outside carport So i can  work on my snowblower or generator when its cold i have no other place to do this i put up a plastic sheet at the opening of the carport which is still well ventilated so it works good but takes more time since its not a garage but for now i can keep warm while i work  I am glad i got it. ']

Title: Lasko Electric Ceramic Portable Oscillating Space Heater 1500-Watt with Timer
Reviews: ['The Lasko Cyclonic ceramic Heater is a great choice to heat a room.  Why?  well, here is what I think about my new heater.First, i was looking for a heater to use in my 160 Sq ft shop, that didn\'t take up a whole bunch of space. The Lasko heater is a good compact size, unlike Baseboard heaters that take up three to five or more feet of wall space, where you can\'t put things in front of them, this heater is only about 17" wide.  Or my former oil radiator heater, that works well, but I had to pull it out from the wall to use it, as it gets hot all around it.This heater will heat a larger room, but I chose it because I wanted a fairly fast warm up, when I start to work.  I chose Electric because I don\'t want fumes or have to worry about getting Propane, or Kerosene.  I like the feel of the Electric heat.This heater has a thermostat that can be set, and a timer if you want it to go off by itself. Very Convenient !  It draws the cool air from the floor, and blows warm air out the top, from it\'s moveable ( up and down) exhaust.  The Fan forced air can travel most of the way across the room, which helps circulate the warmth evenly.The heater fan has two speeds so it\'s quiet enough to use in a bedroom if you want, and can be put right up against the wall so it\'s out of the way.I have used this in my shop for several days now, some as cold as 25 degrees outside, and this Lasko heater warms the shop up to a comfortable (for me) 68 deg. in about 30 minutes.Because it\'s only 25" tall, the temperature the display on the front says, may need to be adjusted to your own likings, but I\'ve found once the whole room has warmed up the temp. displayed is within 2 degrees of the Thermometer I have on the other end of the room.So it does keep up with the set temperature when in thermostat mode fairly well. You can just have it on low heat or high heat all the time, but I like the convenience of the thermostat mode. It\'s simple to operate, and comes in several colors, to match your decor. While the housing is mostly Plastic, the Heater is sturdy enough. Because it is only 6.5" deep, it stays tucked up tight ot the wall out of my way, and doesn\'t heat up the wall, like my oil/electric radiator did, but fear not if you tip it over, it has automatic shutoff.I don\'t have any complaints about this heater. I think it\'s just about perfect for small shops like mine, or a cold bedroom , or even to heat larger areas. Lasko made a good all around Electric heater here.', "i've been using these for 7yrs now, after 4yrs took apart and cleaned them (i have 5) and even the 7yr old works as it did when new, i dont like to waste money so i have stuck with this model, i have the electronic version also (black)at another location, they are okay but not built the same inside, these seem to be better built, they do what they are designed to do, and i always use the ceiling fan to bring the heat down and mix it up so they dont run forever. i run 1 in each bedroom and two in the living room, not too loud, i know they are not a furnace, temperature at the grill is abt 200 degrees coming out so i use the ceiling fans on low or medium to help mix it up otherwise all the heat stays up at the ceiling. I feel this is the best heater in this class.", 'Nice heater that does a great job. Already own 6. Is an inexpensive way to heat house and safer as well. Does not impact the electric bill hardly any at all. Do not have to worry about tipping over, has solid stand. I use to use gas as a means of heating my two story house until I found this type of heater. I have purchased four or five other heaters of this type for relatives and friends.', "bought two of them in the past 2 years and both of them were defective. I have one that is 10 to 15 years old and still works. that's why i wanted one the same brand. MUST NOT BE TESTING THEM !!!", 'Unstable. No tip over feature. Never stopped outgassing plastic smell.', 'Borrowed a lasko heater last year coverage was great economical and safe so bought the same model very happy with it!', 'This heater works safely when it is sitting against the wall. To adjust to any temperature is very easy. It also shows the actual temperature in the area.', 'I purchased this heater, to use in my RV.  It is quite efficient.  Enjoying the efficiency and temperature control.  ', "I now own three (3) of 'em... The oldest one is starting its 5th winter.  ", "OUR LIVING ROOM IS BIG AND WE KEEP THE THERMOSTAT DOWN TO 68 WE NEEDED AN EXTRA HEATER TO HELP KEEP IT WARMER. WE DO NOT LIKE IT HOT TO SLEEP SO WE TRIED THIS. REALLY LIKE IT CAN STAND IT AGAINST THE WALL AND NO WORRIES. THE AIR IS DRAWN IN THE BOTTOM AND COMES OUT THE TOP NICE AND WARM.THE ONLY CHANGE I WOULD MAKE IS FOR THE AIR TO BE DRAWN IN THE TOP AND COME OUT THE BOTTOM NICE AND WARM,DUE TO COLD FLOORS. TRIED TO FIND ONE BUT DIDN'T. ANYHOW, THIS HEATER IS VERY GOOD.EASY TO MOVE. STURDY ENOUGH TO STAY STANDING.  *****    FIVE STARS"]

Title: Mr. Heater F242010 Golf Cart Heater - 4000 BTU
Reviews: ['the actual heater is great. Easy to use and works every time. Problem is with the lower portion that fits into the cup holder. Entire unit is extremely top heavy and can very easily tip out of the cup holder. The fit into the cup holder in my club car golf car is loose and poorly designed. I would not reccomend this item.', 'Have bought 3 different style heaters in 3 years to use golfing (with cart covers) and this Mr. Heater unit is the best. Regarding cost, starting ease, overall warmth, and quality construction this is by far the best heater on the market. Four players in my gaggle of friends (playing in the winter) own this unit and are thoroughly pleased with its performance and durability. If you winter golf, Buy It!', 'I last owned a Coleman brand Golf Cart Heater....it lasted about 10 years and finally died. I purchased this MH4GC unit next and it is not as good as the Coleman unit, but the Coleman unit is no longer made, so I\'m stuck with this one. Couple of issues...first and foremost, this heater is way top heavy so it will NOT stay put in a golf cart cup holder...the slightest bump and it flies right out of the cart\'s cup holder and if it lands on a person, they will get burned....I know, because it happened to me! I now have it "tied" in place with a bungee cord when I use it. No way could the manufacturer have tested this properly...my golf carts are 2017 model electric EZ Go Golf Carts. Second, there is no variable control on the heat...it\'s either wide open or shut off. I\'m not crazy about that, it does consume fuel at a higher rate than one with an adjustable propane flow valve, but you\'re compelled to live with it if you want heat. If I can find another option when this one dies, I will undoubtedly try it.', "Pretty simple to operate. Screw in 1 lb camper gas canister, press 'on' button a couple of times until it lights and you have heat. To turn it off hit the 'off' button. I ordered it for use in a golf cart.  Nothing to put together other than putting the canister into the holder and setting it into a cup holder.", "I had to ding this product because the poorly designed tip-over switch defeats the premise of the product.At even the tiniest bump in the cart path or fairway this heater turns itself off -- you will have to re-light 30+ times per round.It's a shame because it does put out nice heat and is otherwise effective and generally a fair price.The manufacturer missed the mark here.", 'Used it in my side by side this past week while hunting. Takes the rocky roads really well, the stiff north wind did blow it out a couple of times while driving around but overall it worked really well. I would recommend it and it really helps keep you warm while driving around the deer lease.', 'This heater works great in a covered cart, in fact it can get too warm, even when the outside temps  are in upper 30s and lower 40s.  In an open cart you feel the heat when the cart is stationery, however when moving or winds over 10 mph you can feel the heat.  The holder works in the smaller cart cup.Suggest they need to have an adjustable temp knob.All in all, I like the Mr. Heater portable golf cart heater.   ', "I have something similar to this in my shop, but they are bigger, but when they heat up the screens glow orange, this little one doesn't do that so I thought it wasn't working correctly. But if you do like the instructions say and make sure the pilot is lit. Then leave it alone it will start producing heat. ", "Mr. Heater that I got was brand new and worked great.  I even got it 1 day earlier than expected.  I've already used it 3 times and it has worked great!", "I read all the reviews I could find on this heater before purchase, so expected a good product.  It had to sit under the tree for a few days but Christmas morning it was installed in the cart!  It has been out on one excursion and all the guys wanted to 'ride in the warm cart'.  The hubbby is more than pleased!It sits steady in the front cup holder, is cool to the touch on all sides (well not the front of course), and works instantly!  More than pleased hubby here..........."]

Title: Vornado MVH Vortex Heater with 3 Heat Settings, Adjustable Thermostat, Tip-Over
Reviews: ['I live in Nebraska and put the Vornado in a 25’x12’ ventless corner basement room with 4 windows. It works adequately for that room. It takes 10-15 minutes on the high setting to heat entire room so I can’t imagine ever using the low setting there. Maybe in a smaller room or camper or a warmer climate it would be needed. The Vornado is so quiet and the heating element hardly glows, that when first turned on I wasn’t sure it was working. It has a safety switch on the bottom and needs to be placed on a hard flat surface. It’s very compact and the plastic exterior makes it lightweight. That exterior though doesn’t seem real sturdy so I’ve got it up off the floor to avoid getting kicked or trod on. For the price and purpose I’m satisfied.', "After searching for a year for a replacement for our beloved Braun heater we have finally found one that works well. The Vornado is not the design leader that the old Braun was but it does come close on one of the most important features for us. We use this heater in a quiet office environment, therefore the heater has to be quiet. We tried a popular Fasco, a Caframo that is styled after the Braun, and other brands. All were too noisy. The Vornado is not whisper silent like the Braun, but it come close. The noise level is about like a modern computer.Other features we like on the Vornado are the 3 heat settings, a fairly accurate thermostat and a decent length cord. The design is upright where the Braun was low. The vertical design with the large blade fan helps the Vornado more more air which helps warm up the room more quickly. It has a discrete small red led light that lets you know it's on. The heater is made in China.The downsides of this heater are minor. The heat range selector switch is not intuitive and dimly marked. You need to shine a light on it and maybe consult the manual to remember what the cryptic I, II, III markings mean. (I=low, II=med, III=high). And the case is shiny plastic which is a static electricity magnet. It attracts dust and animal hair easily. These are small issues. We normally leave the unit on one heat setting and it is under the desk, so pretty much out of sight. The black case helps it hide. Overall the heater looks to be well made and it's doing its job well. The price is a little high for a simple heater, but we are happy with it.", "This is the third one of these I have bought. While it has a maximum of 1500 watts, these heat a room the most evenly of anything you can buy. It is quiet and you won't get burned like other heaters. ", "This is my second Vornado fan I've purchased. My first one is still working perfectly but I never want to be without one and may use this second one when I travel.  I live in a rental suite that is chilly in Spring and Fall. Despite how benign this fan looks it produces a significant amount of heat.  I only start the day running this heater on the 1000 Watt (medium) setting and then turn down to low for the remainder of the day. It heats my open floor plan living room and dining room exceptionally well without driving up the electrical bill. Cheaper than running the furnace or my natural gas fireplace (altho come winter we use that in conjunction with the heater fan).  Bear in mind this is the most reliable model. Other models of heater fans by Vornado do not have the longevity of this one yet still cost as much or more. Read the reviews and choose this model for great value.", "This little room heater is outstanding. I bought it for my daughter's bedroom is she's on the second floor and as we heat with wood sometimes your room cools down below normal during the winter. This little heater keeps her room nice and toasty I would recommend it", 'Heats the bedroom up quickly. Like the thermostat settings to keep room at even temp.', 'Compact size  heats a room in no time at all   I love it', 'Compact size', 'Quiet efficient small size unit=Love it', 'Vornado heaters are the only ones that I use, as they are dependable, quiet, and safe!  This one is the quietest one I have ever had and, like all Vornado heaters, warms my bedroom in about 2 minutes.  This is one great heater!']

Reviews: ["I am somewhat disappointed with this heater.  I work in a large open workspace and winter mornings can be uncomfortable with lower temperatures. Again, the purpose of this heater was to have a reliable source of warm air to work in my garage.  It simply does not have the blower power that it looks to have. It has some type of thermal overload resistor, but not sure if it will reset like the thermal unit on the coil type.also my unit had been opened and was missing a screw and the center name plate, but I was able to use those parts from the old unit I was replacing.', 'The heater was purchased to replace an old model ceiling heater.  This one, manufactured by Broan, is installed in an elevator.  Normally, elevators are placed inside the building for use and uses the ambient air to heat/cool the space.  This particular elevator is installed on an outside wall and ambient temperatures are hard to come by.The Broan unit is turned on during the fall/winter season and runs almost constantly.  It keeps the elevator well heated.  The installation of the unit is very simple and can readily be installed over a 4x4 electrical box.  After the unit has been in use for awhile, the metal screen covering may begin to rattle.  There is a single phillips-head screw that holds the screen on.  This screw will loosen and requires tightening periodically.  Another alternative is to use a "Lock-Tite" product to secure the screw.  I\'ve tried using lock washers, but they do not hold very well.Overall, the unit is durable.  The small motor that rotates the fan needs to be cleaned and lubricated periodically.  At times, I\'ve found the fan speed slowing down and have had to clean/lubricate the motor to get the fan up to speed.  If the fan motor decreases too much, there is a thermal heat sensor that will cause the heater element to turn off.  This prevents the heater element to overheat and cause a fire.  Overall, a decent little unit that thats the chill off the space during the winter months.  Because of my search for this product, I purchased two of them.  One of them is in \'bench stock\' in case the first one should fail.', 'Don\'t know why I waited so long to purchase and install a ceiling heater in our Master Bath.
